author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Imports or validates custom Snort 3 intrusion rules within a file. Import arguments: rule_import_mode, rule_group_ids.
commands.name: ciscofp-upload-intrusion-rule-file

commands.description: Retrieves the Snort3 Intrusion rule group. If no ID is specified, it retrieves a list of all Snort3 Intrusion rule groups. Default list size is 50. GET argument: intrusion_rule_id | LIST arguments: sort, filter, expanded_response, limit, page, page_size.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-intrusion-rule

commands.description: Creates or overrides the Snort 3 Intrusion rule group with the specified parameters. Guide to Snort 3 rule writing: https://docs.snort.org/welcome.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-intrusion-rule

commands.description: Modifies the Snort3 Intrusion rule group with the specified ID. You must enter one or both of the following: rule_data | rule_group_ids. The variable that was not entered will remain the same. If merging, rule_group_ids must be entered.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-intrusion-rule

commands.description: Deletes the specified Snort3 rule.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-intrusion-rule

commands.description: Retrieves the intrusion policy associated with the specified ID. If no ID is specified, retrieves a list of all intrusion policies. Default list size is 50. GET arguments: intrusion_policy_id, include_count | LIST arguments: expanded_response, limit, page, page_size.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-intrusion-policy

commands.description: Creates an intrusion policy with the specified parameters. This command may take a while, you can set the "execution-timeout" field if necessary (X > 300).
commands.name: ciscofp-create-intrusion-policy

commands.description: Modifies the intrusion policy associated with the specified ID. This command may take a while, you can set the "execution-timeout" field if necessary (X > 300).
commands.name: ciscofp-update-intrusion-policy

commands.description: Deletes the intrusion policy associated with the specified ID.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-intrusion-policy

commands.description: Retrieves the Snort 3 intrusion rule group. If no ID is specified, retrieves a list of all Snort 3 Intrusion rule groups. The default list size is 50. GET arguments: rule_group_id | LIST arguments: expanded_response, filter, limit, page, page_size.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-intrusion-rule-group

commands.description: Creates or overrides the Snort 3 intrusion rule group with the specified parameters.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-intrusion-rule-group

commands.description: Modifies the Snort 3 intrusion rule group with the specified ID.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-intrusion-rule-group

commands.description: Deletes the specified Snort 3 intrusion rule group.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-intrusion-rule-group

commands.description: Retrieves the network analysis policy with the specified ID. If no ID is specified, retrieves a list of all network analysis policies. The default list size is 50. GET arguments: network_analysis_policy_id | LIST arguments: expanded_response, limit, page, page_size.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-network-analysis-policy

commands.description: Creates a network analysis policy. This command may take a while, you can set the "execution-timeout" field if necessary (X > 300).
commands.name: ciscofp-create-network-analysis-policy

commands.description: Modifies the network analysis policy associated with the specified ID. This command may take a while, you can set the "execution-timeout" field if necessary (X > 300).
commands.name: ciscofp-update-network-analysis-policy

commands.description: Deletes the network analysis policy associated with the specified ID.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-network-analysis-policy

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all security zone objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-zones

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all port objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-ports

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all URL category objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-url-categories

commands.description: Retrieves the network objects associated with the specified ID. If no ID is supplied, retrieves a list of all network objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-network-object

commands.description: Creates a network object.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-network-object

commands.description: Updates the specified network object.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-network-object

commands.description: Retrieves the groups of network objects and addresses associated with the specified ID. If no ID is supplied, retrieves a list of all network objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-network-groups-object

commands.description: Creates a group of network objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-network-groups-objects

commands.description: Updates a group of network objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-network-groups-objects

commands.description: Deletes a group of network objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-network-groups-objects

commands.description: Retrieves the groups of host objects associated with the specified ID. If no ID is passed, retrieves a list of all network objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-host-object

commands.description: Creates a host object.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-host-object

commands.description: Updates the specified host object.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-host-object

commands.description: Deletes the specified network object.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-network-object

commands.description: Deletes the specified host object.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-host-object

commands.description: Retrieves the access control policy associated with the specified ID. If no access policy ID is passed, all access control policies are returned.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-access-policy

commands.description: Creates an access control policy.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-access-policy

commands.description: Updates the specified access control policy.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-access-policy

commands.description: Deletes the specified access control policy.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-access-policy

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all custom security group tag objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-security-group-tags

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all ISE security group tag objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-ise-security-group-tag

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all VLAN tag objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-vlan-tags

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all VLAN group tag objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-vlan-tags-group

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all application objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-applications

commands.description: Retrieves the access control rule associated with the specified policy ID and rule ID. If no rule ID is specified, retrieves a list of all access rules associated with the specified policy ID.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-access-rules

commands.description: Creates an access control rule.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-access-rules

commands.description: Updates the specified access control rule.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-access-rules

commands.description: Deletes the specified access control rule.
commands.name: ciscofp-delete-access-rules

commands.description: Retrieves the policy assignment associated with the specified ID. If no ID is specified, retrieves a list of all policy assignments to target devices.
commands.name: ciscofp-list-policy-assignments

commands.description: Creates policy assignments to target devices.
commands.name: ciscofp-create-policy-assignments

commands.description: Updates the specified policy assignments to target devices.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-policy-assignments

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all devices with configuration changes that are ready to deploy.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-deployable-devices

commands.description: Retrieves a list of all device records.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-device-records

commands.description: Creates a request for deploying configuration changes to devices.
commands.name: ciscofp-deploy-to-devices

commands.description: Retrieves information about a previously submitted pending job or task with the specified ID. Used for deploying.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-task-status

commands.description: Retrieves the groups of URL objects and addresses associated with the specified ID. If not supplied, retrieves a list of all URL objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-get-url-groups-object

commands.description: Updates the ID of a group of URL objects.
commands.name: ciscofp-update-url-groups-objects

integration.description: Use the Cisco Firepower integration for unified management of firewalls, application control, intrusion prevention, URL filtering, and advanced malware protection.
integration.name: Cisco Firepower

playbook.description: This playbook will append a network group object with new elements (IPs or network objects).
playbook.name: Cisco FirePower- Append network group object

description: Use the CiscoFirepower integration for unified management of firewalls, application control
name: Cisco Firepower
readme:
## Cisco Firepower Pack

Use the Cisco Firepower integration for unified management of firewalls, application control, intrusion prevention, URL filtering, and advanced malware protection.

**What does this pack do?**
- List zones, ports, and URL categories.
- List security group tags, ise security group tags, vlan tags, vlan tags groups, and applications.
- List, create, and update policy assignments.
- Get, create, update, and delete network objects.
- Get, create, update, and delete network group objects.
- Get, create, update, and delete host objects.
- Get, create, update, and delete access policies.
- Get, create, update, and delete access rules.
- Get deployable devices, device records, and task statuses.
- Deploy to devices.


This pack contains:
- An integration with Cisco Firepower.
- A playbook for appending network objects in Cisco Firepower.
